channel.title: Infoes on State-C Pages
channel.description: Recent content in Infoes on State-C Pages

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Introduction to State-C The State-C project is a simple utility to embed various types of data into an applications data section. It is written in Go, but is primarily intended to help in the development of C and C++ applications. The basic idea is the following: We write a file foo detailing data known at your software’s compile time. We pass this file to State-C, which will produce foo.asm, the equivalent of this file in assembly code (NASM).
